summary: This document is an internal FBI email chain from September 2021 regarding a discovery request for the upcoming Ghislaine Maxwell trial. The FBI Victim Services Division is requesting contact information for any communications between FBI victim specialists and victims/witnesses/attorneys involved in the New York investigation of Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Program Manager
persons.role: Program Manager, Victim Program Management Unit, FBI Victim Services Division
persons.context: The sender of the primary discovery request email, soliciting contact information for communications with victims/witnesses/attorneys for the Maxwell trial discovery.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as a subject of the New York investigation alongside Ghislaine Maxwell, with a trial scheduled.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named as a subject of the New York investigation alongside Jeffrey Epstein, with a trial scheduled for November 29, 2021.

connections.description: Named together as subjects of the New York investigation (50D-NY-3027571), indicating their alleged joint involvement in criminal activity.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell Trial Date
events.description: The scheduled start date for the trial in the New York investigation of Ghislaine Maxwell (and Jeffrey Epstein).

events.title: Discovery Request Deadline
events.description: The deadline (close of business) for FBI personnel to provide contact information for communications with victims/witnesses/attorneys for the Maxwell trial discovery.

keyFacts: The FBI was actively gathering discovery materials for the upcoming Ghislaine Maxwell trial as of September 2021.
The discovery request specifically sought all communications (texts, emails, voicemails) between FBI Victim Services personnel and victims/witnesses/attorneys in the Epstein/Maxwell case.
The request highlights the procedural steps taken by the government to comply with discovery obligations in a high-profile criminal case.
The email chain indicates prior victim briefings had been held in Miami.
The case is identified by the FBI file number 50D-NY-3027571.
